intro: Leontopodium japonicum var. japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese edelweiss, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, white to pale yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, adding a striking visual element to mountainous landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
